alert.note: Alert for Western Plumas County, Lassen Park (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 12:20PM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...An area of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Plumas, east central Tehama, northeastern Butte and southwestern Lassen Counties through 100 PM PDT... At 1218 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Chester to near Storrie. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. This is in the vicinity of the Dixie burn scar. HAZARD...Pea size hail and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chester, Prattville, Lake Almanor Country Club, Seneca, Storrie, Belden, Lake Almanor Peninsula, Butte Meadows, Lake Almanor, Caribou, Mill Creek, Lake Almanor West, Hamilton Branch, Bald Eagle Mountain, Canyondam, East Shore, Almanor, Bucks Lake, Tobin and Twain. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
